title: Labour Agreement visa (subclass 855)
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== Labour Agreement visa (subclass 855) Page Content The Labour Agreement visa (subclass 855) closed to new applications on 1 July 2012. You cannot get this visa. You might be able to apply for the Employer Nomination Scheme (subclass 186) Visa holders Details This information is for people who have been granted a Labour Agreement visa (subclass 855). It explains your rights and obligations. You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check your visa details and entitlements. What this visa lets you do Details This is a permanent residence visa. It lets you and any member of your family unit who has also been granted this visa: stay in Australia indefinitely work and study in Australia enrol in Medicare Australia's scheme for health-related care and expenses apply for Australian citizenship (if you are eligible) sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residence travel to and from Australia for five years from the date the visa is granted (after that time, you will need a resident return visa or another visa to return to Australia). Your obligations Details You do not have to work for the employer who nominated you, but you must comply with any obligations under your employment contracts or industrial laws that require you to give your employer an appropriate period of notice before you stop working for that employer. Your employer’s obligations Details Your employer must: provide a full-time position meet any additional requirements of the Labour Agreement comply with all relevant Australian standards and workplace legislation for wages and working conditions.
main_content:
===== main placeholder ==========================================

# Labour Agreement visa (subclass 855)

Labour Agreement visa (subclass 855)
Page Content

The Labour Agreement visa (subclass 855) closed to new applications on 1 July 2012. You cannot get this visa. You might be able to apply for theEmployer Nomination Scheme (subclass 186).

The Labour Agreement visa (subclass 855) closed to new applications on 1 July 2012. You cannot get this visa. You might be able to apply for the
Employer Nomination Scheme (subclass 186)
.

## Visa holders

Visa holders
Details

This information is for people who have been granted a Labour Agreement visa (subclass 855). It explains your rights and obligations.

This information is for people who have been granted a Labour Agreement visa (subclass 855). It explains your rights and obligations.

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)
for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

### What this visa lets you do

What this visa lets you do
Details

This is a permanent residence visa. It lets you and any member of your family unit who has also been granted this visa:

This is a permanent residence visa. It lets you and any member of your family unit who has also been granted this visa:
- stay in Australia indefinitely
stay in Australia indefinitely
- work and study in Australia
work and study in Australia
- enrol inMedicareAustralia's scheme for health-related care and expenses
enrol in
Medicare
Australia's scheme for health-related care and expenses
- apply for Australian citizenship (if you are eligible)
apply for Australian citizenship (if you are eligible)
- sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residence
sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residence
- travel to and from Australia for five years from the date the visa is granted (after that time, you will need a resident return visa or another visa to return to Australia).
travel to and from Australia for five years from the date the visa is granted (after that time, you will need a resident return visa or another visa to return to Australia).

### Your obligations

Your obligations
Details

You do not have to work for the employer who nominated you, but youmust comply with any obligations under your employment contracts or industrial laws that require you to give your employer an appropriate period of notice before you stop working for that employer.

You do not have to work for the employer who nominated you, but you
must comply with any obligations under your employment contracts or industrial laws that require you to give your employer an appropriate period of notice before you stop working for that employer.

### Your employer’s obligations

Your employer’s obligations
Details

Your employer must:

Your employer must:
- provide a full-time position
provide a full-time position
- meet any additional requirements of the Labour Agreement
meet any additional requirements of the Labour Agreement
- comply with all relevant Australian standards and workplace legislation for wages and working conditions.
comply with all relevant Australian standards and workplace legislation for wages and working conditions.
